footer.copyright: © 2024 Tool-ify.com - All tools are free and work in your browser

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Thank you for using Tool-ify! We value your feedback and suggestions to help us improve our services.
contact.contact_intro: If you have any questions, suggestions, or feedback about our tools, please feel free to reach out to us via email:
contact.response_time: We strive to respond to all inquiries within 48 hours.
contact.about_text1: Tool-ify is a collection of free online utility tools designed to help with everyday tasks. Our tools work entirely in your browser - no installations, no data collection, and no account creation required.
contact.about_text2: We're constantly adding new tools and improving existing ones. If you have ideas for tools you'd like to see added to our collection, please let us know!

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.highlight_text: Tool-ify is designed with your privacy as a priority. Our tools operate entirely within your browser, and we do not collect, store, or process any of your personal data or the content you input into our tools.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.highlight_text: Tool-ify provides free browser-based tools without requiring user registration. While our tools are available for personal and professional use, we ask that you use them responsibly and in accordance with applicable laws.

tips: Use long passwords - Aim for at least 12 characters. Longer passwords are generally more secure.
Use a mix of characters - Combine uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
Avoid personal information - Don't use names, birthdates, or common words that could be easily guessed.
Use different passwords - Each account should have a unique password to prevent multiple breaches if one password is compromised.
Use a password manager - Store your complex passwords securely in a reputable password manager.
Enable two-factor authentication - When available, use 2FA for an extra layer of security beyond just your password.

uuid_info.intro: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) or GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) is a 128-bit identifier that is unique across both space and time. They are commonly used in software development for:
uuid_info.version_4_desc: Version 4 (Random): Generated using random numbers. This is the most common version and is suitable for most applications where uniqueness is required.
uuid_info.version_1_desc: Version 1 (Time-based): Generated using the current timestamp and MAC address of the computer. This version can potentially expose information about when and where the UUID was created.

content.intro: A Unix timestamp (also known as Epoch time, POSIX time, or Unix time) is a system for describing a point in time. It is the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970 (midnight UTC/GMT), not counting leap seconds.
content.reasons_intro: Unix timestamps are widely used in computer systems and programming for various reasons:
reasons: They are easy to store as a single number
Date arithmetic becomes simple addition and subtraction
They are universal across different operating systems and programming languages
content.uses_intro: Common uses for Unix timestamps include:
content.representations_intro: Note that Unix timestamps can be represented in different ways:
content.conclusion: This tool primarily works with the standard seconds-based Unix timestamp.

content.main_desc: The CSS Formatter tool helps you clean up and organize your CSS code, making it more readable and maintainable. It can also minify your CSS to reduce file size for production environments.

formatting_features.title: Indentation
formatting_features.description: Apply consistent indentation using spaces or tabs

formatting_features.title: Brace Placement
formatting_features.description: Format braces on same line or new line based on your preference

formatting_features.title: Property Sorting
formatting_features.description: Organize properties in a consistent order

formatting_features.title: Whitespace
formatting_features.description: Add proper spacing around selectors, properties, and values

minification_features.title: Comment Removal
minification_features.description: Strip out comments to reduce file size

minification_features.title: Whitespace Removal
minification_features.description: Eliminate unnecessary spaces, tabs, and line breaks

minification_features.title: Semicolon Removal
minification_features.description: Remove the last semicolon in each rule when possible

content.main_desc: QR (Quick Response) codes are two-dimensional barcodes that can be scanned by smartphone cameras and other devices to quickly access information or perform actions.

common_uses.title: Website URLs
common_uses.description: Direct users to your website without typing a URL

common_uses.title: Contact Information
common_uses.description: Share contact details that can be saved directly to a phone

common_uses.title: WiFi Access
common_uses.description: Allow quick connection to WiFi networks without typing passwords

common_uses.title: Product Information
common_uses.description: Link to product details, manuals, or authenticity verification

common_uses.title: Marketing Materials
common_uses.description: Use on business cards, flyers, posters, and packaging

content.qr_code_types_desc: This tool supports several QR code types:

qr_code_types.title: vCard
qr_code_types.description: Contact information that can be added to address books

qr_code_types.title: WiFi
qr_code_types.description: Network connection details for easy WiFi access

content.error_correction_desc: QR codes include error correction capabilities that allow them to be readable even if partially damaged or obscured:
content.error_correction_note: Higher error correction levels make the QR code more reliable but also more complex (with more modules/pixels).

content.main_desc: The Unit Converter tool helps you convert between different units of measurement across various categories. Whether you're working on a project, studying, cooking, or traveling, this tool makes unit conversions quick and easy.

categories.title: Length
categories.description: Convert between meters, feet, inches, kilometers, miles, and more

categories.title: Area
categories.description: Convert between square meters, square feet, acres, hectares, and more

categories.title: Volume
categories.description: Convert between liters, gallons, cubic meters, cubic feet, and more

categories.title: Weight/Mass
categories.description: Convert between kilograms, pounds, grams, ounces, tons, and more

categories.title: Temperature
categories.description: Convert between Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin

categories.title: Speed
categories.description: Convert between miles per hour, kilometers per hour, meters per second, and more

categories.title: Time
categories.description: Convert between seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, and more

categories.title: Digital Data
categories.description: Convert between bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, and more

content.systems_desc: This converter supports both metric (used in most countries) and imperial/US customary units (used primarily in the United States). The metric system is based on powers of 10, making conversions within the system straightforward. The imperial/US customary system uses various conversion factors between units.
tips: Always double-check the units you're converting between
Be aware of the difference between US and UK measurements for some units (like gallons)
For scientific work, consider the number of significant figures needed
Temperature conversions use different formulas than simple multiplication
